array.string: The KOOLO app is the result of the experiences and professional, conceptual, technical, creative efforts of many people:
First of all, our enthusiastic co-designers, the Youth Council of the Akershus University Hospital in Lørenskog. For more info: https://www.facebook.com/ungdomsraadet.ahus/

In Australia, Evelyn Culnane and the Transition Support Service of The Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne, who generously shared their transition checklists. For more info: http://www.rch.org.au/transition/

In Canada, Geraldine Cullen-Dean and the Good 2 Go Transition Program of The Sick Children’s Hospital in Toronto, who generously shared their MyHealth 3-Sentence Summary. For more info: http://www.sickkids.ca/good2go/

In Norway, Britt Nakstad and the Adolescent Medicine project of Akershus University Hospital in Lørenskog, who generously shared their Norwegian check lists. For more info: http://www.ungdomsmedisin.no/

And the Department of Informatics at the University of Oslo: Nora Svarverud Aasen, Alma Culén, Chandrasekhar Kamatigam, Sumit Panday, Margaret Machniak Sommervold, Swati Srivastava, and Maja van der Velden. For more info: http://www.kulu.no
For questions, please contact Maja van der Velden, KULU project leader, team@kulu.no
